title-part.text: PHOTOMECHANICAL PRODUCTION OF TEXTURED OR PATTERNED SURFACES, e.g. FOR PRINTING, FOR PROCESSING OF SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICES

reference.text: phototypographic composing devices B41B; photosensitive materials or processes for photographic purposes G03C; electrophotography, sensitive layers or processes therefor G03G

note.note-paragraph:
In this subclass, the following terms or expressions are used with the meanings indicated :
- "photosensitive" means not only sensitive to electro-
magnetic radiation but also to corpuscular radiation;
- "photosensitive compositions" covers photosensitive
substances, e.g. quinonediazides, and, if applicable,
binders or additives;
- "photosensitive materials" covers the photosensitive
compositions, e.g. photoresists, the bases carrying them
and, if applicable, auxiliary layers.

subnote.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC system. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups :
G03F3/08 covered by H04N1/46
G03F7/207 " G03F7/20
G03F7/23 " G03F7/22
G03F9/02 " G03F9/00

title-part.text: Originals for photomechanical production of textured or patterned surfaces, e.g., masks, photo-masks, reticles

note.note-paragraph: In this main group, at each hierarchical level, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the first appropriate place

Groups G03F1/02 - G03F1/16 are no longer used for classification of new documents as from January, 1, 2012. The backfile is being progressively transferred to new groups as follows : - G03F1/02 : G03F1/88 - G03F1/04 : G03F1/90 - G03F1/06 : G03F1/92 - G03F1/08 - G03F1/16 : G03F1/20 - G03F1/86

CPC-specific-text.text: using an elastic substrate or involving an optical distortion, e.g. for printing on non flat surfaces
by drawing, writing, e.g. on a photosensitive surface, or by engraving, e.g. using a stylus; using a typewriter; using chemical copy sheet
the masking pattern being obtained by the application of an ink, e.g. by traditional printing, by ink jet printing, by using a typewriter, or by the selecitive application of a powder, e.g. a toner
the masking pattern being obtained by thermal means, e.g. by laser ablation

reference.text: thermal transfer from a ribbon, e.g. G03F1/0023

CPC-specific-text.text: using chemical means, e.g. chemical camera copying
Phase shift masks
Hybrid phase shift masks, i.e. combining plural types of phase-shifting pattern in a single common pattern

note-paragraph.pre:
- in this group the term "hybrid" is meant to involve the
combination of plural types of phase-shifting pattern in a
single common pattern; a mere structural, e.g. geometrical,
association of masks with separate patterns is not considered
hybrid;
- hybrid masks combining a binary pattern with a
phase-shifting pattern are only classified in the group
corresponding to the phase-shifting aspect, the binary
pattern being considered a trivial feature in this
context

CPC-specific-text.text: Alternating phase shift masks, i.e. Levenson-Shibuya type
Auxiliary patterns or specific arrangements of the phase-shifting elements to avoid phase-conflicts, i.e. phase-shifter layout strategies for alternating masks
Masks with semi-transparent phase shifters, i.e. attenuated phase-shifting masks
Masks where at least part of the patterns comprise no opaque or semi-opaque pattern elements, i.e. phase-edge masks
Auxiliary processes relating to originals, e.g. repair, washing or inspection

title-part.text: by photographic processes for production of originals simulating relief

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. using a heat or pressure sensitive foil, by pulling an impression, e.g. on a photosensitive sheet

title-part.text: Originals having inorganic imaging layers, e.g. chrome masks

reference.text: G03F1/12 takes precedence;

CPC-specific-text.text: X-Ray absorbers G03F1/148

title-part.text: by exposing and washing out pigmented or coloured organic layers

CPC-specific-text.text: the masking pattern being obtained by modification of the polymeric pattern by energetic means, e.g. by carbonisation or by ion implantation
the masking means, e.g. the dye or pigment being incorporated into the photosensitive material

title-part.text: by exposing silver-halide-containing photosensitive materials or diazo-type materials
Originals characterised by structural details, e.g. supports, cover layers, pellicle rings

CPC-specific-text.text: Pellicles, pellicle rings or continuous protective layers
Auxiliary patterns; Corrected patterns, e.g. proximity correction, grey level masks

X-Ray absorbers

title-part.text: Originals having apertures, e.g. for corpuscular lithography
Masks or mask blanks for imaging by charged particle beam [CPB] radiation, e.g. by electron beam
Masks or mask blanks for imaging by radiation of 100nm or shorter wavelength, e.g. X-ray masks, extreme ultra-violet [EUV] masks
with three or more diverse phases on the same PSM
Attenuating PSM [att-PSM], e.g. halftone PSM or PSM having semi-transparent phase shift portion,
Preparation thereof, e.g. optical proximity correction [OPC] design processes
Masks having auxiliary features, e.g. special coatings or marks for alignment or testing
Electrostatic discharge [ESD] related features, e.g. antistatic coatings or a conductive metal layer around the periphery of the mask substrate
Alignment or registration features, e.g. alignment marks on the mask substrate
Testing or measuring features, e.g. grid patterns, focus monitors, sawtooth scales or notched scales
Mask blanks not covered by G03F1/20 - G03F1/34
having two or more different absorber layers, e.g. stacked multilayer absorber
Pellicles, e.g. pellicle assemblies, e.g having membrane on support frame
characterised by the frames, e.g. structure or material, including bonding means therefor
Containers specially adapted for masks, mask blanks or pellicles
Preparation processes not covered by groups G03F1/20 - G03F1/50
Adapting basic layout or design of masks to lithographic process requirement, e.g., second iteration correction of mask patterns for imaging
Repair or correction of mask defects
by charged particle beam [CPB], e.g. focused ion beam
by charged particle beam [CPB], e.g. electron beam patterning of masks
Auxiliary processes, e.g. cleaning or inspecting
prepared by photographic processes for production of originals simulating relief

using coherent light; using polarised light

in the presence of a fluid, e.g. immersion; using fluid cooling means

using originals with apertures, e.g. stencil exposure masks

using a cantilever
Exposure without an original mask, e.g. using a programmed deflection of a point source, by scanning, by drawing with a light beam, using an addressed light or corpuscular source

Size and form of the illuminated area in the mask plane, e.g. REMA

CPC-specific-text.text: Information management and control, including software
Modelling and simulation from physical phenomena up to complete wafer process or whole workflow in wafer fabrication
Data handling, in all parts of the microlithographic apparatus, e.g. addressable masks
Calibration of components of the microlithographic apparatus, e.g. light sources, addressable mask, detectors
Controlling normal operating mode, e.g. matching different apparatus, remote control, prediction of failure
Controlling abnormal operating mode, e.g. taking account of waiting time, decision to rework, rework flow
Tagging, i.e. hardware or software tagging of features or components
Exposure light control, in all parts of the microlithographic apparatus, e.g. pulse length control, light interruption
Dose control, i.e. achievement of a desired dose

reference.text: determination of the required dose G03F7/70625

note.note-paragraph: Groups G03F9/70 - G03F9/00T26 are no longer used for classification of new documents as from January 1, 2012. The backfile is progressively being transferred to new groups as it follows: - G03F9/70 : G03F9/70 - G03F9/00T12 : G03F9/7003 - G03F9/00T14 : G03F9/7049 - G03F9/00T16 : G03F9/7065 - G03F9/00T18 : G03F9/7069 - G03F9/00T20 : G03F9/7073 - G03F9/00T22 : G03F9/7088 - G03F9/00T24 : G03F9/7092 - G03F9/00T26 : G03F9/7096
